connector.description: Send e-mails through AWS SES service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSESClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSESClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSESClient.description: To use the AmazonSimpleEmailService as the client

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SES client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SES client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SES client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which SES client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.replyToAddresses.name: camel.sink.endpoint.replyToAddresses
camel.sink.endpoint.replyToAddresses.description: List of reply-to email address(es) for the message, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReplyToAddresses' header.

camel.sink.endpoint.returnPath.name: camel.sink.endpoint.returnPath
camel.sink.endpoint.returnPath.description: The email address to which bounce notifications are to be forwarded, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReturnPath' header.

camel.sink.endpoint.subject.name: camel.sink.endpoint.subject
camel.sink.endpoint.subject.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSesSubject' is not present.

camel.sink.endpoint.to.name: camel.sink.endpoint.to
camel.sink.endpoint.to.description: List of destination email address. Can be overriden with 'CamelAwsSesTo' header.

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-ses.amazonSESClient.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.amazonSESClient
camel.component.aws2-ses.amazonSESClient.description: To use the AmazonSimpleEmailService as the client

camel.component.aws2-ses.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws2-ses.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SES client

camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SES client

camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-ses.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SES client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-ses.region.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.region
camel.component.aws2-ses.region.description: The region in which SES client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-ses.replyToAddresse.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.replyToAddresses
camel.component.aws2-ses.replyToAddresse.description: List of reply-to email address(es) for the message, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReplyToAddresses' header.

camel.component.aws2-ses.returnPath.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.returnPath
camel.component.aws2-ses.returnPath.description: The email address to which bounce notifications are to be forwarded, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReturnPath' header.

camel.component.aws2-ses.subject.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.subject
camel.component.aws2-ses.subject.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSesSubject' is not present.

camel.component.aws2-ses.to.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.to
camel.component.aws2-ses.to.description: List of destination email address. Can be overriden with 'CamelAwsSesTo' header.

camel.component.aws2-ses.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-ses.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-ses.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-ses.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-ses.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
